inlet.description: If an llll is entered, it is expected to contain: start, end, step, maximum number of items (see llll message).
If an llll is entered, it is expected to contain: end, step, maximum number of items (see llll message).
If an llll is entered, it is expected to contain: step, maximum number of items (see llll message).

objarg.name: start
objarg.description: The starting value for the arithmetic series (see llll message). Default is 0.

objarg.name: end
objarg.description: The ending value for the arithmetic series, which can also be the none symbol (see llll message). Default is none.

objarg.name: step
objarg.description: The step value for the arithmetic series (see llll message). Default is 1.

objarg.name: max_items
objarg.description: The maximum number of items in the output llll, which can also be the none symbol (see llll message). Default is none.

method.name: bang
method.description: A bang outputs the arithmetic series of primes according to the most recently received parameters.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Set start, end, step, maximum number of items
method.description:
In first inlet: starting and ending values of the series, step and maximum number of items. The ending value and maximum number of items can be replaced by the word none. Values set to none are calculated according to the other values if possible. If all the parameters are set, the stronger requirement between ending and maximum number of items is respected. An llll received in the first inlet cause the series to be output.
In second inlet: ending value, step and maximum number of items.
In third inlet: step and maximum number of items.
In fourth inlet: maximum number of items.
In each inlet, if the incoming llll is shorter than described above, the missing parameters are left unchanged.

method.name: number
method.digest: Set start, end, step or maximum number of items
method.description:
In first inlet: sets the starting of the series and output the series.
In second inlet: sets the ending value of the series, which can also be set to none if no ending value is needed.
In third inlet: sets the step of the series.
In fourth inlet: sets the maximum number of items in the series, which can also be set to none if no maximum is needed.
Values set to none are calculated according to the other values if possible. If all the parameters are set, the stronger requirement between ending and maximum number of items is respected.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

entry.name: Inlet 1 (number/pitch/llll)
entry.description: Starting value. If an llll is entered, it is expected to contain: start, end, step, maximum number of items (see llll message).

entry.name: Inlet 2 (number/pitch/none/llll)
entry.description: Ending value. If an llll is entered, it is expected to contain: end, step, maximum number of items (see llll message).

entry.name: Inlet 3 (number/number/none/llll)
entry.description: Step. If an llll is entered, it is expected to contain: step, maximum number of items (see llll message).
